intro: Hieracium naxense, commonly known as the Naxos hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils, often found in alpine or coastal areas. It produces small yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium naxense is known for its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments.
